content.description: Start just right of the large ledge. Climb up and traverse left on the ledge. Clip the first bolt and climb up on large holds past the second bolt. Move left at the large ledge and step up to a pocket out left. Clip the third bolt and top out.  This climb is a sandbag at 5.6, be prepared for a 5.7+.
content.location: Route #9 on Tunnel Block in 2019 guide.

content.description: Second of two routes on Tunnel Block (L)
content.location:
Located down the wall, to the right of Shorty Clips.

 Route #2 on Tunnel Block in 2019 guide.

content.description: Climb the sport route in the center of this face to the top.
content.location:
Only sport line on this wall. Blank rock between Cave World and Tunnel Block in the photo.

 Route #1 on Tunnel Block in 2019 guide.

Located between Tunnel Block (R) and Entrance Block.

 Route #11 in Tunnel Block on 2019 guide.
Located across from Tunnel Block (L). Route #4 on Tunnel Block in 2019 guide.

content.description: Climb the face just right of the crack.
content.location:
Rightmost route on Tunnel Block, right of Center Crack.

 Route #11 in Tunnel Block on 2019 guide.

content.description: This is the easiest sport route at The Lost Crag.  Chuck and his son Henry (Beaumont) helped clean this route, and they were the first ones to climb it.
content.location:
Last route to the right on the Beginner Wall.

 Route #8 on Tunnel Block in 2019 guide.

content.description: Access point to the top of the block.  We solo this "route" when setting top ropes on either of the Tunnel Blocks.  We put anchors on this so that folks could set up a top rope for absolute beginners.  This route is really only a 5.1 or 5.2 and meant to be a first climb for brand new climbers.
content.location:
Located on Tunnel Block (R) directly across from Tunnel Block (L).

 Route #3 on Tunnel Block in 2019 guide.

content.description: Climb the obvious large crack in the center.  The crack is probably only a 5.6, but the final move to clip the anchors is harder.
content.protection: #.75-4 cams, stoppers; mussy hooks on top
content.location: Route #10 in Tunnel Block on 2019 guide.

content.description: Be prepared for a less than secure finish on this climb.  The holds going to the chains are not as good as you would like them to be.
content.location:
To the right of Beginner Wall Center.

 Route #7 on Tunnel Block in 2019 guide.

content.description: Fun sport route on Beginner Wall that has more secure clipping holds than its two brothers to the right.  It is a touch harder than H.B's Big Climb on the far right of the wall, but easier than the two routes in the middle of the wall.
content.location:
Left most problem on Tunnel Block (R) on Beginner Wall.

 Route #5 on Tunnel Block in 2019 guide.

content.description: Like it's neighbor to the right,  be prepared for a less than secure finish on this climb.  The holds going to the anchors are not as good as you would like them to be.
content.location:
Left side of Tunnel Block.

 Route #6 on Tunnel Block in 2019 guide.

content.description: This area has the greatest concentration of easy sport climbs for new leaders.
